Uses of Class
com.google.crypto.tink.integration.android.AndroidKeysetManager

  • Packages that use AndroidKeysetManager 
    Package Description
    com.google.crypto.tink.integration.android  

    • Uses of AndroidKeysetManager in com.google.crypto.tink.integration.android

      Methods in com.google.crypto.tink.integration.android that return AndroidKeysetManager 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      AndroidKeysetManager AndroidKeysetManager.add(KeyTemplate keyTemplate)
      Deprecated. 
      This method takes a KeyTemplate proto, which is an internal implementation detail. Please use the add method that takes a KeyTemplate POJO.
      AndroidKeysetManager AndroidKeysetManager.add(KeyTemplate keyTemplate)
      Generates and adds a fresh key generated using keyTemplate.
      AndroidKeysetManager AndroidKeysetManager.Builder.build()
      Builds and returns a new AndroidKeysetManager with the specified options.
      AndroidKeysetManager AndroidKeysetManager.delete(int keyId)
      Deletes the key with keyId.
      AndroidKeysetManager AndroidKeysetManager.destroy(int keyId)
      Destroys the key material associated with the keyId.
      AndroidKeysetManager AndroidKeysetManager.disable(int keyId)
      Disables the key with keyId.
      AndroidKeysetManager AndroidKeysetManager.enable(int keyId)
      Enables the key with keyId.
      AndroidKeysetManager AndroidKeysetManager.promote(int keyId)
      Deprecated. 
      use setPrimary
      AndroidKeysetManager AndroidKeysetManager.rotate(KeyTemplate keyTemplate)
      Deprecated. 
      Please use add(com.google.crypto.tink.proto.KeyTemplate). This method adds a new key and immediately promotes it to primary. However, when you do keyset rotation, you almost never want to make the new key primary, because old binaries don't know the new key yet.
      AndroidKeysetManager AndroidKeysetManager.setPrimary(int keyId)
      Sets the key with keyId as primary.
